intro: Leucospermum spathulatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads surrounded by pale yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and evergreen foliage. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
